subject: Libel and Slander
Suits and Litigation
Steroids
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Texas dismissed a large portion of a defamation lawsuit filed by Roger Clemens against his chief accuser and former trainer, Brian McNamee. In the ruling, United States District Judge Keith P. Ellison said that statements McNamee made to George J. Mitchell about Clemens’s alleged use of steroids and human growth hormone were privileged because they were made in connection with a federal investigation. All that remained of the lawsuit were Clemens’s accusations that McNamee defamed him when he told Andy Pettitte in 1999 or 2000 that Clemens used performance-enhancing drugs.
